trait.name: Empowered Attacks
trait.text: Maegera's slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to damage from nonmagical attacks.

trait.name: Fire Aura
trait.text: At the start of each of Maegera's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it takes 35 (10d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature also takes 35 (10d6) fire damage from touching Maegera or from hitting it with a melee attack while within 10 feet of it, and a creature takes that damage the first time on a turn that Maegera moves into its space. Nonmagical weapons that hit Maegera are destroyed by fire immediately after dealing damage to it.

trait.name: Fire Form
trait.text: Maegera can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing if fire could pass through that space.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: Maegera sheds bright light in a 120-foot radius and dim light for an additional 120 feet.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Maegera can innately cast fireball (spell save DC 19) at will, requiring no material components. Maegera's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Maegera has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Maegera makes three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) bludgeoning damage plus 35 (10d6) fire damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Maegera can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Maegera regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Quench Magic
legendary.text: Maegera targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. Any resistance or immunity to fire damage that the target gains from a spell or a magic item is suppressed. This effect lasts until the end of Maegera's next turn.

legendary.name: Smoke Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Maegera exhales a billowing cloud of hot smoke and embers that fills a 60-foot cube. Each creature in that area takes 11 (2d10) fire damage. The cloud lasts until the end of Maegera's next turn. Creatures completely within the cloud are blinded and can't be seen.

legendary.name: Create Fire Elemental (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Maegera's hit points are reduced by 50 as part of it separates and becomes a fire elemental with 102 hit points. The fire elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of Maegera and acts on Maegera's initiative count. Maegera can't use this action if it has 50 hit points or fewer. The fire elemental obeys Maegera's commands and fights until destroyed.

monster.spells: fireball

monster.name: Malformed Kraken
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: understands Common but can't speak; telepathy 60 ft.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 239

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks. One of them can be replaced with a bite attack, and any of them can be replaced with Fling.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Fling
action.text: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken's tentacles is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Lightning Storm
action.text: The kraken creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 150 feet of it. A target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 227

trait.name: Attractive Pollen (1/Day)
trait.text: When the mantrap detects any creatures nearby, it can use its reaction to release pollen out to a radius of 30 feet. Any beast or humanoid within the area must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be forced to use all its movement on its turns to get as close to the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the mantrap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary tropical plant.

action.name: Engulf
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is trapped inside the mantrap's leafy jaws. While trapped in this way, the target is blinded and restrained, has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the mantrap, and takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the target's turns. If the mantrap dies, the creature inside it is no longer restrained by it. A mantrap can engulf only one creature at a time.
Blinded:
• A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 248

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Sheriff Markham of Bryn Shander is a brawny, likable man of few words. Nothing is more important to him than protecting Icewind Dale. He judges others by their actions, not their words.
Ideal: "All people deserve to be treated with dignity."
Bond: "Duvessa is a natural leader, but she needs help. That's my job."
Flaw: "I bury my emotions and have no interest in small talk."

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Markham makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10+2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10+1) piercing damage. Markham carries twenty crossbow bolts.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 199

trait.name: Earthen Defeat
trait.text: When Marlos drops to 0 hit points, his body transforms into mud and collapses into a pool. Anything he is wearing or carrying is left behind.

trait.name: Earth Passage
trait.text: Marlos can move in difficult terrain composed of anything made from earth or stone as if it were normal terrain. He can move through solid earth and rock as if it were difficult terrain. If he ends his turn there, he is shunted into the nearest space he last occupied.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If Marlos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
trait.text: When a creature that can see Marlos's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of him, Marlos can force it to make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw if Marlos isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Marlos until the start of its next turn, when it can decide to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Marlos in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If Marlos sees himself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of him and in an area of bright light, Marlos is, due to his curse, affected by his own gaze.
Petrified:

• A petrified creature is transformed, along with any nonmagical object it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Its weight increases by a factor of ten, and it ceases aging.
• The creature is incapacitated (meaning it can't take actions or reactions), can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• The creature has resistance to all damage.
• The creature is immune to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Marlos makes three melee attacks, one with his snake hair and two with Ironfang.

action.name: Snake Hair
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

action.name: Ironfang
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) thunder damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 244

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the maw of Sekolah fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The maw of Sekolah can breathe only underwater

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The maw of Sekolah makes one attack with its bite and one attack with its tail smash.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Smash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 9 (1d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions
legendary.text: The maw of Sekolah can take 3. legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The maw regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The maw of Sekolah makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Speed of Sekolah
legendary.text: The maw of Sekolah moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Feed (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The ferocious spirit of Sekolah flashes through the water, tearing through the foes of the maw of Sekolah. Each creature of the maw's choosing within 60 feet of it must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh, p. 244

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The salvager can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The salvager makes two attacks with its coral rapier.

action.name: Coral Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Inject Toxin (2/Day)
action.text: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage, and the creature must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Minotaur Living Crystal
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 245

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The statue makes two attacks, one with its greataxe and one gore attack

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Flying Shards
reaction.text: In reaponse to a creature hitting the statue with a melee weapon attack the statue deals 11 (2d10) piercing damage to the attacker.

monster.name: Miraj Vizann

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 198

trait.name: Earth Walk
trait.text: Moving through difficult terrain made of earth or stone costs Miraj no extra movement.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Miraj's innate spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save DC 14). He can innately cast the following spell, requiring no material components:
• 1/day: pass without trace

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Miraj is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following sorcerer spells:
• Cantrips (at will): acid splash, blade ward, friends, light, message, mold earth
• 1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, mage armor, magic missile
• 2nd level (3 slots): Maximilian's earthen grasp, shatter, suggestion
• 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, erupting earth
• 4th level (3 slots): polymorph, stoneskin
• 5th level (2 slots): wall of stone
• 6th level (1 slot): move earth

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8+1) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

monster.spells: pass without trace, acid splash, blade ward, friends, light, message, mold earth, chromatic orb, mage armor, magic missile, Maximilian's earthen grasp, shatter, suggestion, counterspell, erupting earth, polymorph, stoneskin, wall of stone, move earth

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 251

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Innkeeper Mires is a retired carnival attraction, dubbed "the Yeti" because of his barrel-shaped body and the thick, white hair covering his arms, chest, back, and head. When Goldenfields suffers, so does his business, so he takes strides to protect the compound.
Ideal: "As does the Emerald Enclave, I believe that civilization and the wilderness need to learn to coexist."
Bond: "Make fun of me all you like, but don't speak ill of my inn or my employees!"
Flaw: "When something upsets me, I have a tendency to fly into a rage."

action.name: Bearhug
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13) and takes 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of Miros's turns until the grapple ends. Mires cannot make attacks while grappling a creature.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10) piercing damage. Miros carries ten crossbow bolts.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 234

trait.name: Extraordinary Feature
trait.text: The mongrelfolk has one of the following extraordinary features, determined randomly by rolling a d20 or chosen by the DM:
1-3 — Amphibious: The mongrelfolk can breathe air and water.
4-9 — Darkvision: The mongrelfolk has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
10 — Flight: The mongrelfolk has leathery wings and a flying speed of 40 feet.
11-15 — Keen Hearing and Smell: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
16-17 — Spider Climb: The mongrelfolk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
18-19 — Standing Leap: The mongrelfolk's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.
20 — Two-Headed: The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The mongrelfolk can mimic any sounds it has beard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mongrelfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw or dagger.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

monster.name: Monstrous Peryton
monster.languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 245

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The peryton doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The peryton has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the peryton failes a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The peryton makes two attacks, one with its gore and one with its talons.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 12 (2d6+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 16 (2d10+5) slashing damage.

action.name: Warp Shadow
action.text: The peryton chooses up to three creatures within 60 feet of it that it can see. Each creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become cursed. While cursed, whenever the creature makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it must roll a d4 and subtract that number from the roll. A cursed creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this peryton's Warp Shadow for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions
legendary.text: The peryton can take 3 legendary actions, choose from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The peryton regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The peryton makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Talons Attack
legendary.text: The peryton makes one attack with its talons

legendary.name: Dive Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The peryton moves up to its speed towards one target of its choosing. It then makes a gore attack that deals an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage on a hit.

monster.name: Mormesk the Wraith
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Lost Mines of Phandelver p. 59

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The wraith can move through an object or another creature, but can't stop there.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d8+3) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. If this attack reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

monster.name: Muiral

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Muiral fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Muiral makes three attacks: two with his longsword and one with his sting.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.text: Muiral can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Muiral regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cast Cantrip
legendary.text: Muiral casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Lunging Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Muiral makes one longsword attack that has a reach of 10 feet.

legendary.name: Retreating Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Muiral moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Before the move, he can make one longsword attack.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Muiral is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp
• 1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, fog cloud, magic missile, shield
• 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, knock, see invisibility, spider climb
• 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, lightning bolt
• 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, polymorph
• 5th level (2 slots): animate objects, wall of force
• 6th level (1 slots): create undead, flesh to stone
• 7th level (1 slots): finger of death

monster.name: Narrak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Out of the Abyss p. 232

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: Narrak has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Narrak has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Narrak is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (Save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks) Narrak has two 2nd-level spell slots, which he regains after finishing a short or long rest, and knows the following Warlock spells:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, friends, poison spray
1st level: armor of Agathys, charm person, hex
2nd level: hold person, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Narrak has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Armor of Shadows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Narrak casts mage armor on himself.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: One with Shadows
reaction.text: While he is in dim light or darkness, Narrak can become invisible. He remains so until he moves or takes an action or reaction.
Invisible:

• An invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of hiding, the creature is heavily obscured. The creature's location can be detected by any noise it makes or any tracks it leaves.
• Attack rolls against the creature have disadvantage, and the creature's attack rolls have advantage.

monster.spells: eldritch blast, friends, poison spray, armor of agathys, charm person ,hex, hold person, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 254

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of his turns, Narth can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Narth sells gear to adventurers, and he also has an adventurous spirit. The Lionshield Coster pays him well, but he longs to make a name for himself. At the same time, he runs a business with his partner Alaestra and knows she wouldn't forgive him if he ran off and never returned.
Ideal: "The bigger the risk, the greater the reward."
Bond: "I adore my colleague Alaestra, and I'd like to do something to impress her."
Flaw: "I'll risk life and limb to become a legend."

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage. Narth carries twenty crossbow bolts.

monster.name: Naxene Drathkala

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 252

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Naxene is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence {spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips {at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Goldenfields' crops are vital to Waterdeep's survival, which is why the Watchful Order of Magists and Protectors sent Naxene to make sure the temple-farm is adequately defended. At first she regarded the task as a punishment, but now she appreciates the peace and quiet.
Ideal: "There's no problem that can't be solved with magic."
Bond: "I have great respect for Lady Laeral Silverhand of Waterdeep. She and the Lords' Alliance are going to bring some much-needed order to this lawless land."
Flaw: "I'm too smart to be wrong about anything."

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8-1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

monster.spells: fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, mage armor, magic missile, shield, misty step, suggestion, fly, lightning bolt

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 240

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The nereid can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Invisibility
trait.text: If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

trait.name: Mantle Dependent
trait.text: The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and hit points equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

trait.name: Shape Water
trait.text: The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of 30 feet and can affect a cube of water no larger than 30 feet on a side.

trait.name: Speak with Animals
trait.text: The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

action.name: Blinding Acid
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) acid damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the nereid's next turn.
Blinded:
• A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

action.name: Drowning Kiss (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The nereid touches one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) acid damage. On a failure, it also runs out of breath and can't speak for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Water Lash
action.text: The nereid causes a 5-foot cube of water within 60 feet of it to take a shape of its choice and strike one target it can see within 5 feet of that water. The target must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and if it is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line or is knocked prone (nereid's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: The Rise of Tiamat p. 91

trait.name: Draconic Majesty
trait.text: Neronvain adds his Charisma bonus to his AC (included).

action.name: Fey Ancestry
action.text: Magic can't put Neronvain to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Neronvain makes two attacks, either with his shortsword or Eldritch Arrow.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage.

action.name: Eldritch Arrow
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

action.name: Poisonous Cloud (2/Day)
action.text: Poison gas fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point Neronvain can see within 50 feet of him. The gas spreads around corners and remains until the start of Neronvain's next turn. Each creature that starts its turn in the gas must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

monster.name: Nezznar the Black Spider

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Lost Mines of Phandelver p. 59

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Nezznar has a spider staff.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Nezznar has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: Nezznar has disadvantage on attack rolls when he or his target is in sunlight.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Nezznar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: dancing lights
• 1/day each: darkness, faerie fire (save DC 12)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Nezznar is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). Nezznar has the following spells prepared from the wizard's spell list:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, ray of frost, shocking grasp
• 1st Level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield
• 2nd Level (3 slots): invisibility, suggestion

action.name: Spider Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire, mage hand, ray of frost, shocking grasp, mage armor, magic missile, shield, invisibility, suggestion

monster.name: Nimblewright
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: understands one language known by its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Waterdeep: Draon Heist p. 212

trait.name: Magical Resistance
trait.text: The nimblewright has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The nimblewright's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Repairable
trait.text: As long as it has at least 1 hit point remaining, the nimblewright regains 1 hit point when a mending spell is cast on it

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The nimblewright has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nimblewright makes three attacks: two with its rapier and one with its dagger.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit 6 (1d4+4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The nimblewright adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the nimblewright must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Nimir

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 256

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Nimir can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Nimir's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light
3/day each: control weather, water breathing

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Nimir is an insightful, even-keeled storm giant who believes that a lasting alliance between giants and small folk can make the world a safer, more enlightened place. He believes King Hekaton was wise to choose Princess Serissa as his heir apparent, and it would never occur to him to question their orders.
Ideal: "It's the duty of the big to protect the small."
Bond: "I'd give my life to defend my king and his royal line."
Flaw: "I never question orders."

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Nimir makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6+9) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12+9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Nimir hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point he can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light, control weather, water breathing

monster.name: Ogremoch
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 216

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
trait.text: Ogremoch's slam attacks are treated as magical and adamantine for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Ogremoch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: meld into stone, move earth, wall of stone

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Ogremoch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Ogremoch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: Ogremoch deals double damage to objects and structures with his melee and ranged weapon attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ogremoch makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boulder
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 500 ft., one target. Hit: 46 (7d10+8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Summon Elementals (1/Day)
action.text: Ogremoch summons up to three earth elementals and loses 30 hit points for each elemental he summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Ogremoch, and disappear if Ogremoch is reduced to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Ogremoch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Ogremoch regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Illuminating Crystals
legendary.text: Ogremoch's crystalline protrusions flare. Each creature within 30 feet of Ogremoch becomes outlined in orange light, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against an affected creature has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature can't benefit from being invisible.

legendary.name: Stomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Ogremoch stomps the ground, creating an earth tremor that extends in a 30-foot radius. Other creatures standing on the ground in that radius must succeed on a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

legendary.name: Create Gargoyle (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Ogremoch's hit points are reduced by 50 as he breaks off a chunk of his body and places it on the ground in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of him. The chunk of rock instantly transforms into a gargoyle and acts on the same initiative count as Ogremoch. Ogremoch can't use this action if he has 50 hit points or fewer. The gargoyle obeys Ogremoch's commands and fights until destroyed.

monster.spells: meld into stone, move earth, wall of stone

monster.name: Olhydra
monster.resist: lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 218

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
trait.text: Olhydra's slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Olhydra's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: wall of ice
• 3/day: ice storm
• 1/day: storm of vengeance

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Olhydra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Olhydra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Water Form
trait.text: Olhydra can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. She can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Olhydra makes two slam attacks or two water jet attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Olhydra can grapple up to four targets. When Olhydra moves, all creatures she is grappling move with her.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.

action.name: Water Jet
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked prone if it fails a DC 19 Strength saving throw.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Summon Elementals (1/Day)
action.text: Olhydra summons up to three water elementals and loses 30 hit points for each elemental she summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Olhydra, and disappear if Olhydra is reduced to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Olhydra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Olhydra regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Crush
legendary.text: One creature that Olhydra is grappling is crushed for 21 (3d10+5) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Fling (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Olhydra releases one creature she is grappling by flinging the creature up to 60 feet away from her, in a direction of her choice. If the flung creature comes into contact with a solid surface, such as a wall or floor, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was flung.

legendary.name: Water to Acid (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Olhydra transforms her watery body into acid. This effect lasts until Olhydra's next turn. Any creature that comes into contact with Olhydra or hits her with a melee attack while standing within 5 feet of her takes 11 (2d10) acid damage. Any creature grappled by Olhydra takes 22 (4d10) acid damage at the start of its turn.

monster.spells: wall of ice, ice storm, storm of vengeance

monster.name: One-Eyed Shiver

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 207

trait.name: Chilling Mist
trait.text: While it is alive, the one-eyed shiver projects an aura of cold mist within 10 feet of itself. If the one-eyed shiver deals damage to a creature in this area, the creature also takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The one-eyed shiver is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand
• 1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, mage armor, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): mirror image, misty step
• 3rd level (2 slots): fear

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye of Frost
action.text: The one-eyed shiver casts ray of frost from its missing eye. If it hits, the target is also restrained. A target restrained in this way can end the condition by using an action, succeeding on a DC 13 Strength check.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage hand, fog cloud, mage armor, thunderwave, mirror image, misty step, fear

monster.name: Ooze Master
monster.resist: lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 241

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: The ooze master doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
trait.text: A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.
The Ooze Master can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Instinctive Attack
trait.text: When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of l action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray
1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots):fear, slow, stinking cloud
4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's black tentacles
5th level (1 slot): cloudkill.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm
reaction.text: If a creature the Ooze Master can see makes an attack roll against it while within 30 feet of it, the Ooze Master can use a reaction to divert the attack if another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature that is closest to it, not including itself or the Ooze Master. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, the attacker is immune to this Instinctive Charm for 24 hours. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

monster.spells: acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray, charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness, detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion, fear, slow, stinking cloud, confusion, Evard's black tentacles, cloudkill

monster.name: Oreioth

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 211

trait.name: Grim Harvest
trait.text: Once per turn when Oreioth kills one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, he regains hit points equal to twice the spell's level.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Oreioth is a 6th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp
• 1st level (4 slots): false life, mage armor, magic missile, ray of sickness
• 2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, misty step
• 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, vampiric touch

trait.name: Swift Animation (Recharges after a Long Rest)
trait.text: When a living Medium or Small humanoid within 30 feet of Oreioth dies, he can use an action on his next turn to cast animate dead on that humanoid's corpse, instead of using the spell's normal casting time.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, false life, mage armor, magic missile, ray of sickness, crown of madness, misty step, animate dead, vampiric touch

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 252

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
trait.text: Oren can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than his.

trait.name: Lucky
trait.text: When Oren rolls a l on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Stout Resilience
trait.text: Oren has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Oren came to Northfurrow's End looking for easy work and found it. He sings for his supper, drinks like a fish, and wanders the fields at night dreaming up new lyrics to entertain the inn's other guests. Oren likes to stir up trouble from time to time, but he doesn't have a mean bone in his body.
Ideal: "Music is food for the soul."
Bond: "You had me at 'Can I buy you a drink?'"
Flaw: "I have a knack for putting myself in harm's way. Good thing I'm lucky!"

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage. Oren carries four daggers.

monster.name: Orlekto

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 256

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Orlekto can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Orlekto's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light
3/day each: control weather, water breathing

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Orlekto is in love with Princess Mirran and wants to see her become Queen of the lyrmskull Throne. (If Mirran is dead, Orlekto aims to avenge her.) If the opportunity to eliminate Hekaton or Serissa presents itself, Orlekto seizes it. Until then, he conceals his treacherous nature.
Ideal: "Storm giants should rule the world. Weak leaders have let dragons and others steal what the gods gave to us!"
Bond: "I serve Princess Mirran and her alone."
Flaw: "For Mirran's love or my revenge, I'd betray my king and my honor."

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Orlekto makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6+9) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12+9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Orlekto hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point he can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light, control weather, water breathing

monster.name: Othovir

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 255

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Othovir is a 2nd-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13; +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following sorcerer spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): blade ward, fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation
1st level (3 slots): mage armor, thunderwave, witch bolt

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Othovir is a gifted harness-maker who doesn't talk about his family or where he came from. He cares about his business, his clients, and his good name.
Ideal: "Find what you do well, and do it to the best of your ability."
Bond: "I won't allow my name to be tarnished."
Flaw: "I get angry when others pry into my private life."

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Othovir adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Othovir must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: blade ward, fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation, mage armor, thunderwave, witch bolt

monster.name: Phantom Warrior
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 235

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
trait.text: The phantom warrior can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The phantom warrior can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Armor and Shield
trait.text: The phantom warrior's AC accounts for its spectral armor and shield.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The phantom warrior makes two attacks with its spectral longsword.

action.name: Spectral Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
action.text: The phantom warrior enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

monster.name: Pharblex Spattergoo

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Hoard of the Dragon Queen p. 91

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Pharblex can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Poison Strike (3/Day)
trait.text: Once per turn, when Pharblex hits with a melee attack, he can expend a use of this trait to deal an extra 9 (2d8) poison damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Pharblex is a 6th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Pharblex has the following spells prepared from the druid spell list:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, poison spray
• 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, healing word, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): barkskin, beast sense, spike growth
• 3rd level (3 slots): plant growth, water walk

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: As part of his movement and without a running start, Pharblex can long jump up to 20 feet and high jump up to 10 feet.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: Pharblex has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Pharblex attacks twice. Once with his bite and once with his spear.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit. reach 5 ft. or ranged 20 ft./60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, poison spray, cure wounds, entangle, healing word, thunderwave, barkskin, beast sense, spike growth, plant growth, water walk

monster.name: Pidlwick II
monster.languages: understands Common but doesn't speak and can't read or write

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 236

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: During the first round of combat, Pidlwick II has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't had a turn yet.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 247

trait.name: Cargo Hauler
trait.text: The bosun has advantage on Strength checks.

trait.name: Sea Legs
trait.text: The bosun has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

action.name: Light Hammer
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hook
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13).

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 247

trait.name: Flourish
trait.text: The captain adds its Charisma modifier to the damage for its longsword attacks (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sea Legs
trait.text: The captain has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The captain makes two attacks, one with its hand crossbow and one with its longsword.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 9 (1d8+5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10+5) slashing damage if used with two hands.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/day)
reaction.text: Whenever a friendly crearure within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

monster.name: Pirate Deck Wizard

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 248

trait.name: Sea Legs
trait.text: The wizard has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The deck wizard is a 4th-level spellcaster, its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): friends, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost. 1st level (4 slots): disguise self, fog cloud, mage armor, witch bolt. 2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, Melf's acid arrow, misty step.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: friends, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, disguise self, fog cloud, mage armor, witch bolt, gust of wind, Melf's acid arrow, misty step

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 248

trait.name: Sea Legs
trait.text: The first mate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The first mate makes two attacks with its longsword.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 6 (1d8+2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10+2) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, the first mate can choose to deal no damage with the attack to disarm the target. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding on the ground.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 229

trait.name: Terror Dive
trait.text: If the pterafolk is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target, and then hits that target with a melee weapon attack, the target is frightened until the end of its next turn.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The pterafolk makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. Alternatively, it makes two melee attacks with its javelin.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 242

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wormling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage, and if the target is a Small or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the wormling. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wormling, and it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of the wormling's turns. If the wormling takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wormling must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the wormling. If the worm ling dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Tail Stinger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Rahadin

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 237

trait.name: Deathly Choir
trait.text: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a mind blank spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people Rahadin has killed. As a bonus action, Rahadin can force all creatures that can hear the screams to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Rahadin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
3/day: misty step, phantom steed
1/day: magic weapon, nondetection

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Rahadin attacks three times with his scimitar, or twice with his poisoned darts.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6+6) slashing damage.

action.name: Poisoned Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4+6) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

monster.spells: misty step, phantom steed, magic weapon, nondetection

monster.name: Ras Nsi

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 230

trait.name: Death Curse
trait.text: Having died and been brought back to life, Ras Nsi is suffering from the death curse. His hit point maximum is reduced to 107, and decreases by 1 for each day that passes during the adventure.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Ras Nsi wears bracers of defense, wields a flame tongue longsword, and carries a sending stone matched to one carried by the guide Salida (see chapter 1).

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: Ras Nsi can use his action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into his yuan-ti form. His statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He doesn't change form if he dies.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Ras Nsi's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Ras Nsi is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Ras Nsi has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, fire bolt, mage hand, mending, poison spray
1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, false life, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, hold person, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, fireball
4th level (3 slots): blight, polymorph
5th level (2 slots): contact other plane, geas
6th level (1 slot): create undead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Ras Nsi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ras Nsi makes three melee attacks, but can use Constrict only once.

action.name: Bite (Snake Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Ras Nsi can't constrict another target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Flame Tongue Longsword (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10+3) slashing damage when used with two hands, plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, fire bolt, mage hand, mending, poison spray, expeditious retreat, false life, magic missile, shield, blindness/deafness, hold person, misty step, animate dead, counterspell, fireball, blight, polymorph, contact other plane, geas, create undead, animal friendship, suggestion

monster.name: Rath Modar

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Hoard of the Dragon Queen p. 92

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Rath has a staff of fire, and scrolls of dimension door, feather fall, and fireball.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Rath is an 11th-level spellcaster who uses Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Rath has the following spells prepared from the wizard spell list:
• Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp
• 1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, color spray, mage armor, magic missile
• 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, phantasmal force
• 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, major image
• 4th level (3 slots): confusion, greater invisibility
• 5th level (2 slots): mislead, seeming
• 6th level (1 slot): globe of invulnerability

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Illusory Self (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When a creature Rath can see makes an attack roll against him, he can interpose an illusory duplicate between the attacker and him. The attack automatically misses Rath, then the illusion dissipates.

monster.spells: fire bolt, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, chromatic orb, color spray, mage armor, magic missile, detect thoughts, mirror image, phantasmal force, counterspell, fireball, major image, confusion, greater invisibility, mislead, seeming, globe of invulnerability

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 201

trait.name: Searing Armor
trait.text: The razerblast's armor is hot. Any creature grappling the razerblast or grappled by it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the end of that creature's turn.

trait.name: Shrapnel Explosion
trait.text: When the razerblast drops to 0 hit points, a flaming orb in its chest explodes, destroying the razerblast's body and scattering its armor as shrapnel. Creatures within 10 feet of the razerblast when it explodes must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The razerblast makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Lost Mines of Phandelver p. 61

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ruffian makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Hoard of the Dragon Queen p. 93

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Rezmir has the Black Dragon Mask, Hazirawn, and an insignia of claws.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Rezmir can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Dark Advantage
trait.text: Once per turn, Rezmir can deal an extra 10 (3d6) damage when she hits with a weapon attack, provided Rezmir has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Draconic Majesty
trait.text: While wearing no armor and wearing the Black Dragon Mask, Rezmir adds her Charisma bonus to her AC (included).

trait.name: Immolation
trait.text: When Rezmir is reduced to 0 hit points, her body disintegrates into a pile of ash.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If Rezmir fails a saving throw while wearing the Black Dragon Mask, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Greatsword (Hazirawn)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6+6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points for 1 minute. The target can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this effect early on a success.

action.name: Caustic Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Rezmir breathes acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Rezmir can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Rezmir regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Darkness (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: If she is wearing the Black Dragon Mask, Rezmir can take up to two legendary actions between each of her turns, taking the actions all at once or spreading them over the round. A legendary action can be taken only at the start or end of a turn.

A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends from a point Rezmir can see within 60 feet of her and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as Rezmir maintains concentration, up to 1 minute. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the area overlaps with a area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Rezmir makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Hide
legendary.text: Rezmir takes the Hide action.

monster.name: Rictavio
monster.skill: Arcana +9, Insight +7, Medicine +7, Perception +7, Religion +6, Sleight of Hand +4

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 238

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: In addition to his sword cane, Rictavio wears a hat of disguise and a ring of mind shielding, and he carries a spell scroll of raise dead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Rictavio is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Rictavio has the following cleric spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, mending, thaumaturgy
•1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary
•2nd level (3 slots): augury, lesser restoration, protection from poison
•3rd level (3 slots): magic circle, remove curse, speak with dead
•4th level (3 slots): death ward, freedom of movement
•5th level (1 slot): dispel evil and good

trait.name: Undead Slayer
trait.text: When Rictavio hits an undead with a weapon attack, the undead takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage of the weapon's type.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Rictavio makes two attacks with his sword cane.

action.name: Sword Cane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage (wooden cane) or piercing damage (silvered sword).

monster.spells: guidance, light, mending, thaumaturgy, cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary, augury, lesser restoration, protection from poison, magic circle, remove curse, speak with dead, death ward, freedom of movement, dispel evil and good

monster.name: Rip Tide Priest

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh, p. 248

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The priest is a 5th-level spellcast. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorceror spells: Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost. 1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield. 2nd level (3 slots): blur, hold person. 3rd level (2 slots): sleet storm.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost, expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield, blur, hold person, sleet storm

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 196

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
trait.text: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 10 feet (included in its speed).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The monk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The monk adds 2 to its AC against one melee or ranged weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the monk must see the attacker.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Ghosts of Saltmarsh, p. 249

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The blademaster has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
trait.text: The blademaster can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
trait.text: The blademaster can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blademaster makes three attacks with its wavecutter blade, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy

trait.text: The coral smasher can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The coral smasher makes two attacks with its warhammer, or one attack with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 7 (1d8+3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage.
