legendary.text: The statue can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options nelpw. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The statue regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: The statue makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Blood Reaper
legendary.text: All creatures currently cursed by the statue and within 20 feet of it take 5 necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The statue moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Vanifer

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 203

trait.name: Funeral Pyre
trait.text: When Vanifer drops to 0 hit points, her body is consumed in a flash of fire and smoke. Anything she was wearing or carrying is left behind among ashes.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If Vanifer fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Vanifer is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). Vanifer knows the following sorcerer spells:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch, fire bolt, friends, mage hand, message, produce flame, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): burning hands, chromatic orb, hellish rebuke, shield
• 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, detect thoughts, misty step, scorching ray
• 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, hypnotic pattern
• 4th level (3 slots): wall of fire
• 5th level (2 slots): dominate person

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Vanifer makes two attacks.

action.name: Tinderstrike
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4+5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, fire bolt, friends, mage hand, message, produce flame, thaumaturgy, burning hands, chromatic orb, hellish rebuke, shield, darkness, detect thoughts, misty step, scorching ray, counterspell, fireball, hypnotic pattern, wall of fire, dominate person

monster.name: Vladimir Horngaard
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 242

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Vladimir regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Vladimir's body is destroyed only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: When Vladimir's body is destroyed, his soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
trait.text: Vladimir is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
trait.text: Vladimir knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and Vladimir are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by Vladimir dies, Vladimir knows.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Vladimir makes two fist attacks or two attacks with his +2 Greatsword.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which Vladimir has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, Vladimir can grapple the target (escape DC 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

action.name: Greatsword +2
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6+4) slashing damage. Against Strahd, Vladimir deals an extra 14 (4d6) slashing damage with this weapon.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
action.text: Vladimir targets one creature he can see within 30 feet of him and against which he has sworn vengeance. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until Vladimir deals damage to it, or until the end of Vladimir's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of Vladimir for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see Vladimir, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

monster.name: Volothamp “Volo” Geddarm
monster.skill: Animal Handling +4, Arcana +4, Deception +5, History +4, Insight +2, Investigation +4, Perception +2, Performance +7, Persuasion +7, Sleight of Hand +3, Survival +2

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 235

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Volo is a 1st-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): friends, mending, prestidigitation
1st level (2 slots): comprehend languages, detect magic, disguise self

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: friends, mending, prestidigitation, comprehend languages, detect magic, disguise self

monster.name: Werebat
monster.speed: 30 ft. (climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft., in bat or hybrid form)
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered weapons

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Waterdeep - Dungeon of the Mad Mage p. 317

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it. is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
trait.text: The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Nimble Escape (Humanoid Form Only)
trait.text: The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack

action.name: Bite (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage, and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy

action.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Wereraven
monster.speed: 30 ft., fly 50 ft. in raven and hybrid forms
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 242

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

action.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

action.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

monster.name: White Maw
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, prone

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 248

trait.name: Ooze Nature
trait.text: White Maw doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Amorphous Form
trait.text: White Maw can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
trait.text: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits White Maw corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits White Maw is destroyed after dealing damage.
White Maw can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While White Maw remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from white stone.

trait.name: Killer Response
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn in White Maw's space is targeted by a pseudopod attack if White Maw isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage. If the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

monster.name: Wiggan Nettlebee

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 211

trait.name: Brave Devotion
trait.text: Wiggan has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Wiggan is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, mending, shillelagh, thaumaturgy
• 1st Level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, healing word, inflict wounds, speak with animals
• 2nd Level (3 slots): barkskin, spike growth, spiritual weapon

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Wiggan makes two attacks with his wooden cane.

action.name: Wooden Cane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 — 1) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

monster.spells: guidance, light, mending, shillelagh, thaumaturgy, animal friendship, cure wounds, healing word, inflict wounds, speak with animals, barkskin, spike growth, spiritual weapon

monster.name: Windharrow

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 192

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Windharrow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Windharrow is an 8th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Windharrow knows the following bard spells:
• Cantrips (at will): friends, prestidigitation, vicious mockery
• 1st level (4 slots): disguise self, dissonant whispers, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, shatter, silence
• 3rd level (3 slots): nondetection, sending, tongues
• 4th level (2 slots): confusion, dimension door

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Windharrow makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage.

monster.spells: friends, prestidigitation, vicious mockery, disguise self, dissonant whispers, thunderwave, invisibility, shatter, silence, nondetection, sending, tongues, confusion, dimension door

monster.name: Xandala

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 236

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Xandala is a 9th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Xandala has the following sorcerer spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, fire bolt, light, mage hand, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, feather fall, shield
2nd level (4 slots): invisibility, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): fireball, fly
4th level (3 slots): ice storm, polymorph
5th level (1 slot): dominate person

trait.name: Quickened Spell (3/Day)
trait.text: When she casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, Xandala changes the casting time to 1 bonus action for that casting.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

monster.spells: acid splash, fire bolt, light, mage hand, ray of frost, chromatic orb, feather fall, shield, invisibility, misty step, fireball, fly, ice storm, polymorph, dominate person

monster.name: Yakfolk Priest

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 245

trait.name: Spellcaster
trait.text: The yakfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14; +6 to hit with spell attacks). The yakfolk has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): bane, command, cure wounds, sanctuary
2nd level (3 slots): augury, hold person, spiritual weapon
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, protection from energy, sending
4th level (1 slot): banishment

trait.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.

The possession lasts until either the body drops to O hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yakfolk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target: Hit: 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage, or 12 (2d8+3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Summon Earth Elemental (1/Day)
action.text: The yakfolk summons an earth elemental. The summoned elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of the summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

monster.spells: flight, mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy, bane, command, cure wounds, sanctuary, augury, hold person, spiritual weapon, bestow curse, protection from energy, sending, banishment

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 244

trait.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.

The possession lasts until either the body drops to O hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yakfolk makes two attacks, either with its greatsword or its longbow.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

monster.name: Yan-C-Bin
monster.resist: cold, fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 220

trait.name: Air Form
trait.text: Yan-C-Bin can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. He can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing if air could pass through that space.

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
trait.text: Yan-C-Bin's slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Yan-C-Bin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: gust of wind, invisibility, lightning bolt
• 2/day each: chain lightning, cloudkill, haste

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Yan-C-Bin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Yan-C-Bin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Yan-C-Bin makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8+7) force damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

action.name: Thundercrack (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Yan-C-Bin unleashes a terrible thundercrack in a 100-foot- radius sphere centered on himself. All other creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or take 31 (9d6) thunder damage and be deafened for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is deafened until the start of Yan-C-Bin's next turn.
Deafened:
• A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: Yan-C-Bin polymorphs into a Medium humanoid. While in polymorphed form, a swirling breeze surrounds him, his eyes are pale and cloudy, and he loses the Air Form trait. He can remain in polymorphed form for up to 1 hour. Reverting to his true form requires an action.

action.name: Summon Elementals (1/Day)
action.text: Yan-C-Bin summons up to three air elementals and loses 30 hit points for each elemental he summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Yan-C-Bin, and disappear if Yan-C-Bin is reduced to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Yan-C-Bin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Yan-C-Bin regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Peal of Thunder
legendary.text: Yan-C-Bin unleashes a peal of thunder that can be heard out to a range of 300 feet. Each creature within 30 feet of Yan-C-Bin takes 5 (1d10) thunder damage.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Yan-C-Bin magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Yan-C-Bin is wearing or carrying is teleported with him.

legendary.name: Suffocate (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Yan-C-Bin steals the air of one breathing creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points and is dying. On a successful save, the target can't breathe or speak until the start of its next turn.

monster.spells: gust of wind, invisibility, lightning bolt, chain lightning, cloudkill, haste

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 237

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the creeper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary flowering vine.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The creeper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the creeper takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The creeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) psychic damage. If the target is a humanoid that drops to 0 hit points as a result of this damage, it dies and is implanted with a yellow musk creeper bulb. Unless the bulb is destroyed, the corpse animates as a yellow musk zombie after being dead for 24 hours. The bulb is destroyed if the creature is raised from the dead before it can transform into a yellow musk zombie, or if the corpse is targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic before it animates.

action.name: Yellow Musk (3/Day)
action.text: The creeper's flowers release a strong musk that targets all humanoids within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the creeper for 1 minute. A creature charmed in this way does nothing on its turn except move as close as it can to the creeper. A creature charmed by the creeper can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Charmed:
• A charmed creature can't attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects.
• The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 237

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is fire or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Out of the Abyss p. 233

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If Yestabrod fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (3d4+1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.

action.name: Caustic Spores (1/Day)
action.text: Yestabrod releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of Yestabrod's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
action.text: Yestabrod releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: Yestabrod can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Yestabrod regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Corpse Burst
legendary.text: Gore, offal, and acid erupt from a corpse within 20 feet of Yestabrod. Creatures within 10 feet of the corpse must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage.

legendary.name: Foul Absorption
legendary.text: Yestabrod absorbs putrescence from a corpse within 5 feet of it, regaining 1d8+2 hit points

monster.name: Yusdrayl

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 248

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Yusdrayl is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Yusdrayl has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: Yusdrayl has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of her allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp, burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 251

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Zi is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Zi Liang is a devout worshiper of Chauntea, the Earth Mother. She has considerably less faith in Goldenfields' defenders, so she patrols the temple-farm during her off-duty hours.
Ideal: "If we faithfully tend to our gardens and our fields, Chauntea will smile upon us."
Bond: "Goldenfields is the breadbasket of the North. People depend on its safety and prosperity, and I'll do what must be done to protect it."
Flaw: "I don't trust authority. I do what my heart says is right."

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zi makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8+1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage. Zi carries twenty sling stones.

monster.name: Zindar

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 239

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Zindar is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Zindar knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, friends, light, mage hand, mending, message
1st level (6 slots): magic missile, shield, sleep
2nd level (4 slots): detect thoughts, knock
3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, tongues
4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, stoneskin
5th level (3 slots): hold monster, telekinesis
6th level (1 slot): true seeing
7th level (1 slot): fire storm

trait.name: Dragon Wings
trait.text: As a bonus action on his turn, Zindar can sprout a pair of dragon wings from his back, gaining a flying speed of 30 feet until he dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Zindar uses one of the following options:

Fire Breath: Zindar exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Weakening Breath: Zindar exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: fire bolt, friends, light, mage hand, mending, message, magic missile, shield, sleep, detect thoughts, knock, clairvoyance, tongues, dominate beast, stoneskin, hold monster, telekinesis, true seeing, fire storm

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 241

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The zorbo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Natural Armor
trait.text: The zorbo magically absorbs the natural strength of its surroundings, adjusting its Armor Class based on the material it is standing or climbing on: AC 15 for wood or bone, AC 17 for earth or stone, or AC 19 for metal. If the zorbo isn't in contact with any of these substances, its AC is 10.

action.name: Destructive Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature wearing armor, carrying a shield, or in possession of a magic item that improves its AC, it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, one such item worn or carried by the creature (the target's choice) magically deteriorates, taking a permanent and cumulative _1 penalty to the AC it offers, and the zorbo gains a +1 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield or magic item that drops to a 0 AC increase is destroyed.
